There are various ways you could proceed with trying to gain an assistant position within a research institution, including:

1. Build relevant skills: First and foremost, build up your qualifications and expertise in the field of research in which you want to work as an assistant. This may involve completing relevant coursework or training programs, attending workshops or conferences related to the field, staying current on published research findings in professional journals, getting involved in lab or practitioner internships if applicable.

2. Network: Attend events both internal and external to your target research institution where researchers gather (e.g., conferences, symposia) so that you can network with colleagues who may have inside knowledge about available positions.

3. Utilize campus resources at a nearby university or college such as their career services center; they often provide information about local research institutions seeking assistants/trainees/apprentices/interns/student workers for their staff/research projects/grant-funded studies etc.

4. Develop relationships with faculty/staff members affiliated with the targeted research institute through informational interviews/internship opportunities/mentorship expectations over time via ongoing communication ahead of applying formally for desired positions within those facilities when job openings surface.
